messages: 0f4595c37bd4856046bc293c3a31cad2 (22:26): why does samba not work outside of a LAN by itself? ran into some problems getting that to work
0f4595c37bd4856046bc293c3a31cad2 (22:26): trying to remember the reasons why.
c3c99b128f26787b29dfed35ba7d9f04 (22:27): Security is probably one of the bigger reasons.
825dda37f12fa7ea379bc38cc3c7e06c (22:27): Anyone in here use Logmein.com to access a Windows PC?
c3c99b128f26787b29dfed35ba7d9f04 (22:27): jade: my advice would be to set up a VPN to the LAN with Samba on it.
3834eb8b8521999f782ed9934a215a12 (22:38): Hello whenever my windows machines try to login into the samba server it takes a very very very long time to  login and logout, any ideas?
3834eb8b8521999f782ed9934a215a12 (22:38): It also seems to be sending a lot of data
645f2c6fd3cc09212e8ed0faae3fa7db (22:49): posix4e: disable caching of profiles locally
645f2c6fd3cc09212e8ed0faae3fa7db (22:49): it takes forever to synchronise
3834eb8b8521999f782ed9934a215a12 (23:13): How does one disable caching of local profiles?
869bc7b89036e2454e91cbfe9faaf52a (23:17): convert then to local ones.  or, move your "my documents" to a network drive and stop storing crap on the desktop
869bc7b89036e2454e91cbfe9faaf52a (23:18): though I think there is a reg hack to move the desktop folder to the network also, but I haven't tried it yet
3834eb8b8521999f782ed9934a215a12 (23:23): How does one convert them to local ones?
3834eb8b8521999f782ed9934a215a12 (23:23): Do you mean add them manually on each computer?
3a64fd8dc092adbe521eb363f92d951b (23:30): use the Group Policy Editor (gpedit.msc) and enable "Computer Configuration\Administrative Templates\System\User Profiles\Only allow local user profiles"
3a64fd8dc092adbe521eb363f92d951b (23:31): how many clients
3834eb8b8521999f782ed9934a215a12 (23:31): eh 10, is this the same winx from efnet?
3a64fd8dc092adbe521eb363f92d951b (23:32): you may want to do the reg  hack then
3834eb8b8521999f782ed9934a215a12 (23:32): DO I have to do it on every computer?
3a64fd8dc092adbe521eb363f92d951b (23:33): but it is a one time deal
3a64fd8dc092adbe521eb363f92d951b (23:33): which is good
3a64fd8dc092adbe521eb363f92d951b (23:33): REGEDIT4
3a64fd8dc092adbe521eb363f92d951b (23:33): [HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\System]
3a64fd8dc092adbe521eb363f92d951b (23:33): "LocalProfile"=dword:00000001
3a64fd8dc092adbe521eb363f92d951b (23:33): [HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Group Policy Objects\LocalMachine\Software\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\System]
3a64fd8dc092adbe521eb363f92d951b (23:33): "LocalProfile"=dword:00000001
3a64fd8dc092adbe521eb363f92d951b (23:34): watch for text wrap
3a64fd8dc092adbe521eb363f92d951b (23:34): [hkey...] = one line
869bc7b89036e2454e91cbfe9faaf52a (23:49): and disable profiles in samba
869bc7b89036e2454e91cbfe9faaf52a (23:49): so you won't have to do it again for new users/pc's
eab42c169adc8c5d2f875bf2e9aac3f2 (00:03): for some reason i still can't browse my shares, i'm using Debian Unstable Samba 3.0.23c
6942481f8438abffd8a9eff882766ab9 (00:10): hi, is samba using 1/4 of bandwidth per file on purpose? :)
30acf32f65007f527c482fef01043f22 (00:18): there is an overhead using the SMB protocol
30acf32f65007f527c482fef01043f22 (00:18): however, SAMBA uses much less overhead than the win32 implementation
30acf32f65007f527c482fef01043f22 (00:18): typically, it sits around 5-10%
869bc7b89036e2454e91cbfe9faaf52a (00:19): he's a gonner
30acf32f65007f527c482fef01043f22 (00:20): that'll teach me, ignoring PARTS and such
fcf1890dfe912ace6fb9835402bbfe49 (00:31): how do i share files with a windows pc using samba??
30acf32f65007f527c482fef01043f22 (00:32): mosh: follow a howto from samba.org
30acf32f65007f527c482fef01043f22 (00:32): then ask us a specific question if you get stuck
fcf1890dfe912ace6fb9835402bbfe49 (00:32): ok thanks
eab42c169adc8c5d2f875bf2e9aac3f2 (00:40): for some reason i still can't browse my shares, i'm using Debian Unstable Samba 3.0.23c
eab42c169adc8c5d2f875bf2e9aac3f2 (00:40): anyone else having this problem?
30acf32f65007f527c482fef01043f22 (00:41): check yoru logs first
30acf32f65007f527c482fef01043f22 (00:41): debian is known to botch almost all their packages
abe59155aa41ae19e4ea964e9dd4b200 (00:47): http://www.bagdadsoftware.de")
